entry.title: SAP Community Voice: Site Improvements, New Badges, and Hot Content
entry.content:
If youâ€™re a Whatâ€™s New regular, you know weâ€™ve been busy since our last newsletter edition on August 15. Weâ€™ve launched new progression badge sets (with more coming in September), made several site improvements, and announced a redesign pilot for blog posts.

If you missed those updates, we summarize them for your convenience below. We also highlight popular blog posts from SAP and non-SAP members, introduce new groups and topic pages, and cover upcoming events.

Read on to learn more!

 

Featured Content

 

ABAP Extensibility Guide â€“ Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

SAPâ€™s @OlgaDolinskaja gives a breakdown of new clean-core extensibility guidance and explains how the ABAP extensibility guide has been updated with guidelines that align with and support the clean-core level concept for the classification of custom extensions. You wonâ€™t want to miss this post and its lively thread! 

Read the blog post

 

Introducing the New AI Adapter for SAP Integration Suite

@Punith_Oswal, one of our SAP Champions, has a question for you: Have you ever wished that your iFlow could talk to ChatGPT? If you answered yes, youâ€™ll want to take some time out of your day to read this post. And if you answered no, I still feel pretty positive youâ€™ll enjoy this contribution.

Read the blog post

 

New Series: SAP UX Q3/2025 Updates

A new series from SAPâ€™s @ThomasReiss provides an overview of user experience innovations in the cloud from the last six months, covering the whole portfolio, such as AI and Joule, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508, and SAP SuccessFactors, as well as detailing innovations in SAPâ€™s UI technologies for building great UX.

Start with the first post, which contains links to the entire series

 

SAP Cloud Application Programming Model with Local App Previews

Iâ€™m happy to see our SAP Champions have been so active with their blogging this month! @MioYasutake has written a short blog post detailing experiences while trying out virtual endpoints with SAP Cloud Application Programming Model with Node.js. The post covers findings while testing local previews.

Read the blog post

 

Community News

 

Badges, Badges, and More Badges!

Long-time SAP Community members may remember the days when they could earn sets of badges for ongoing positive contributions. Well, weâ€™ve brought these progression badges back! This week, we rolled out four new badges based on the number of kudos received. Last week we assigned badges for providing solutions to questions. And there are more badges coming in the weeks ahead. With these badges, weâ€™re once again recognizing active members and encouraging everyone to make our community a better place by participating more frequently. Make sure to subscribe to Whatâ€™s New so you wonâ€™t miss more badge announcements next month!

 

New Features: Dark Mode (Beta) and Events Listings

A beta version of dark mode is available for SAP Community, and our events listings now include additional filtering options that make it easier for you to find activities of interest to you. You can learn more about these two new features in this post. Experiment with dark mode/light mode to see which presentation works best for you, and try out the various new event filters to find educational and social get-togethers in your area that appeal to you.

 

Your Feedback Wanted for New Design Pilot

Weâ€™re currently running a pilot to test a new layout for blog posts that removes widgets and white space from the right column â€“ based on a feature request from members who asked us to improve the readability of these pages. You can learn more about this pilot in this post, and weâ€™re inviting members to share their opinions in the comments there. The pilot concludes on Tuesday, September 23, so please leave your input there before then.

 

New Location Groups Now Available

Weâ€™ve launched (or renamed) three location groups. Our Brazilian members continue to expand our groups in the Americas â€“ with the recent addition of Joinville. Over in the Europe section, the former â€™s-Hertogenbosch group has switched its name to The Netherlands to accommodate more members in that country. Elsewhere in Europe, weâ€™ve introduced the DÃ¼sseldorf-KÃ¶ln group to bring together members from those cities. If youâ€™re from one of these areas, youâ€™ll want to join the corresponding group so you can connect with members close to you.

 

Upcoming Events

 

Meet SAP TechEd Community Speaker Marla Alschweiki

@TammyPowlas, part of our SAP Mentors program, has referred to the upcoming SAP TechEd event as a family reunion, and so itâ€™s no surprise sheâ€™s showing familial-type support for another SAP Mentor, @Marla-Schwaiki (whom we mentioned in the last edition of SAP Community Voice). In this post, Tammy explains why you should attend Marlaâ€™s community talk in Berlin. We love seeing members supporting members, so if youâ€™re planning to attend SAP TechEd, please make sure to include Marlaâ€™s session in your schedule.

 

Find Meetup Events in Your Region

In the last two SAP Community Voice newsletters, weâ€™ve focused on SAP CodeJam events, but as explained earlier in this edition, our events listings have been expanded to include filters for finding a variety of local activities. Therefore, Iâ€™d like to use this edition to draw attention to meetups (also known as SAP Stammtisch events in Germany) in September. Next month, you can socialize with members in Wien (Austria), Gurugram (India), Casablanca (Morocco), Dortmund (Germany), Cyprus (Greece), Brussels (Belgium), Warsaw (Poland), Lingen (Germany), Bamberg (Germany), Hamburg (Germany), Porto (Portugal), Rio Grande do Sul (Brazil), and Luzern (Switzerland). You can find a full list of events here. Make sure to register for an event near you!

Una agenda de lujo

  • SAP QM Quality Management en S/4 HANA - Valdevair Bezerra compartiÃ³ las innovaciones mÃ¡s importantes para la industria
  • S/4 Public Cloud: ImplementaciÃ³n Ã¡gil y diferenciada - Jean Baena y Clariana Narcizo demostraron las ventajas de esta modalidad

Rumbo a SIT Paraguay 2025

entry.title: ðŸŸ¡ Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt ðŸ”¨ðŸª™ ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues from several missions, described in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as values for ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.â€Œ

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Hunt

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample hunt (just a warm-up, no points will be earned). Each mission is independent of the other.

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

You can also see the hex digits in the description.

26SAP Community

Inside this blog post, use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the cell immediately to the left (in this very table) and find the 6-digit RGB ASCII code for the color of the text. 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits (13 in all), in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

ðŸ‘‰In this blog post, post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase). You won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example hunt, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) hunt

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

ðŸ‘‰To be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

â€Œ When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25
26 To be released Sept. 29
34 To be released Sept. 29
42 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2
54 To be released Oct. 6
66 To be released Oct. 6
76 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 9
86 To be released Oct. 13
91 To be released Oct. 13
10None (directly) Watch the Developer News of Oct. 16

Good luck!

entry.title: SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025: A Technical Consultant's Journey Through Innovation, AI Use cases
entry.content:
As I sit down to consider the amazing experience of SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025, which was conducted on August 2nd at the grand St. Xavier's University in New Town, I'm blessed to have such a huge sense of appreciation for the chance to have been included in such a motivating community event. Not only did I come as an avid SAP technical consultant but also as a coordinating volunteer for Track 2, and this provided me with an unrivalled insight into both the organizational expertise and technical expertise that made this event so exceptional.

The Perfect Setting for Innovation
St. Xavier's University Kolkata offered the perfect setting for our community meet. 

The commitment of the university to excellence was reflected in each and every aspect, from the state-of-the-art conference rooms to the stable network infrastructure underpinning our live demos and interactive sessions. Having been to many technical conferences, I can safely say that the venue contributed significantly to delivering the quality experience that SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025 provided.

Track 2: Leading the Charge in Enterprise Transformation
Since I was the coordinating volunteer for Track 2, I had the privilege of collaborating very closely with some of the greatest minds in the SAP universe. Our track covered intelligent enterprise transformation and had the most innovative topics that are revolutionizing the way companies do business today.

RISE with SAP: Charting the Path to Intelligence
The day started with Debashis Majumder's engaging session on "RISE with SAP: Your Path to the Intelligent Enterprise". This session was all the more insightful because it highlighted how RISE with SAP is an end-to-end transformation package that brings together SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the SAP Business Technology Platform, and managed services to deliver an end-to-end digital transformation solution.

What I was most impressed by in this session was the way that RISE with SAP covers the entire range of enterprise requirements - from managed services and cloud infrastructure to business transformation as a service, as well as emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and robotic process automation. As a technical consultant, I appreciated the conversation regarding the subscription model and the cost-effectiveness. This is especially important for the clients that I deal with who are looking at cloud migration strategies.

Joule Studio: Democratization of AI Agent Development
Koushik Goon's "What is Joule Studio and how it works?" presentation was completely captivating. Joule Studio, under SAP Build, is a game-changer in how we work with AI-powered business automation. The ability to design and deploy custom Joule agents and skills with easy-to-use drag-and-drop simplicity presents huge opportunities for companies to make AI solutions customized to their requirements.

The showcase of how developers can create AI agents that solve goal-oriented, complex business situations using dynamic planning and reasoning was impressive. The SAP and third-party application integration ensures the AI agents integrate well across various technology landscapes, a key requirement in the heterogeneous environments most companies use today.

Business AI and S/4HANA Integration
Sangeeta Majumder's presentation on "Business AI Use Cases with S/4HANA and SAP's AI Suite" offered real-world examples of how artificial intelligence is being integrated into central business processes. The session touched on real-world applications across business functions, from procurement optimization to financial reporting, illustrating quantifiable business value.

IBM's GenAI Assets and Platform Accelerators
The shared session between Aditi Chatterjee and Avijit Dhar on "Overview of IBM's Latest GenAI Assets and Process Accelerators on the IBM-SAP Platform" brought out the strategic significance of partner ecosystems in providing end-to-end AI solutions. Their observations about how IBM's generative AI assets are bundled with SAP platforms for speeding up business processes were especially insightful to understanding the wider AI picture beyond SAP's native capabilities.

Intelligent Invoicing Revolution
Arit Basu's talk on "Intelligent Invoicing using SAP Business Network" highlighted the real-world application of AI to daily business practices. The Intelligent Invoice Conversion functionality, leveraging Document Information Extraction (DOX) technology, to convert PDF and image-based invoice files into structured SAP Business Network invoices automatically, is a major step in accounts payable automation.

I was amazed by the demonstration of how machine learning algorithms automatically extract and map invoice information, with an easy-to-use interface for suppliers to create annotation rules for complicated invoice data. This product solves a genuine pain point that most of my customers experience in their procure-to-pay processes.

Next-Generation Field Mobility
The last Track 2 session, "Next-Gen Field Mobility: What's New in SAP Service and Asset Manager 2505" by Abhishek Chatterjee, discussed the transformation of mobile enterprise apps. The emphasis on growing field service functions with enhanced mobility solutions was a big hit with many of the participants who have asset-heavy businesses.

Networking: The Heart of Community Building
One of the greatest assets of SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025 was the awesome networking opportunity it offered. As noted in numerous community forums, networking for SAP technical consultants is not merely a matter of swapping business cards - it's about creating enduring professional relationships that enable knowledge sharing, career growth, and access to out-of-the-way opportunities.

Throughout the event, I engaged in substantive discussions with:

Other ABAP colleagues who exchanged innovative coding methods and debugging approaches

S/4HANA transformation project peers working on similar functional consulting projects

Industry specialists who shared their vision on upcoming trends and best practices

Community leaders leading different SAP user groups in India

The afternoon fireside chat with community contributors was most informative, with participants from AWS User Group Kolkata, Kolkata WordPress Community, Databricks Community India, and SAP Community Kolkata. This inter-community collaboration session, led by Dipanwita Dutta, highlighted the need to bridge different technology communities to promote innovation and learning.

Keynote Insights and Industry Perspectives
The keynote sessions on the first day of the event established a strong tone for the whole event. SAP Community Senior Director Josh "Bluebeard" Bentley's speech highlighted the importance of community-based learning and collaboration in the SAP community. His perspectives on how the international SAP community keeps adapting and evolving with emerging technologies were inspiring and thought-provoking.

Srini Gottimukkula's keynote provided valuable industry perspectives on the current state and future direction of SAP technologies. The emphasis on intelligent enterprises and the role of AI-driven transformation aligned perfectly with the themes explored throughout our track sessions.

The welcome address by Reverend Dr. John Felix Raj, the Honourable Vice Chancellor of St. Xavier's University, beautifully captured the spirit of academic excellence and community collaboration that characterized the entire event.

Panel Discussions: Multiple Insights on Digital Transformation
The two panel sessions offered multiple perspectives on hot issues impacting the SAP community:

Panel Session 1 included industry experts such as Pankaj Lal, Prasun Dutta, Debashis Majumdar, Sarmistha Shanyal, and Tilak Kumar Dhar, moderated by Monimoy Kundu. The topics discussed ranged from practical SAP implementation strategy tips to lessons learned from actual projects.

Panel Session 2 represented a coming together of academic and industry viewpoints with speakers consisting of Prof. Amlan Chakrabarti, Dr. Indranil Mitra, Manoj Mishra, Dr. Saptarsi Goswami, Sabyasachi Biswas, and Srini Gottimukkula, moderated by Amitava Nag. The session offered useful insights into the convergence of academic research and industry usage in the SAP space.

Technical Deep Dives Across Multiple Tracks
Though I was mainly busy coordinating Track 2, I got a chance to visit sessions on other tracks during the break times:

Track 1 had extensive sessions on supply chain transformation using AI-driven intelligence, next-gen warehouse operations, and cloud ALM roadshow presentations. The focus on real-world applications and live demos made these sessions very useful.

Track 3 explored in-depth generative AI embedding within business strategy, SAP BTP highlights from the view of a Basis consultant, and best practices for SAP S/4HANA transformation. The session on "Leveraging SAP Conversational & Generative AI: Bengali Code Bot" was also very innovative and highlighted how AI can be localized for local needs.

Track 4 was data engineering and analytics, with sessions on Databricks, AWS and SAP integration, and foundation for Gen AI with SAP. These sessions gave a proper understanding of the overall ecosystem of technologies that go along with SAP solutions.

Key Takeaways for Technical Consultants
Being a SAP technical consultant, some key learnings that will have a direct effect on my work are:

1. AI Integration is Accelerating
The prolonged emphasis on Joule, AI agents, and intelligent automation in several sessions undoubtedly demonstrates that the integration of AI is no longer a consideration for the future - it's an existing imperative. Technical consultants must acquire skills in AI-powered SAP solutions to stay relevant.

2. Cloud-First Mindset is Mandatory
RISE with SAP and the other cloud-focused sessions validated that the sector has moved irrevocably towards cloud-first approaches. Cloud deployment models, migration approaches, and hybrid architectures are essential knowledge areas for technical consultants.

3. Low-Code/No-Code Platforms are Mainstream
The exhibition of Joule Studio's drag-and-drop feature and equivalent platforms in other sessions demonstrated that low-code development is going mainstream. Technical consultants must adopt these platforms alongside core development expertise.

4. Community Involvement Spur Learning
The networking and information exchange that were experienced during the event proved the tremendous benefit of an engaged community. Bi-weekly exposure to the SAP Community Network, local user communities, and events such as SAP Inside Track is crucial for career development.

Organizational Excellence Behind the Scenes
As a coordinating volunteer, I developed profound respect for the colossal effort that went into making this event happen. The SAP Inside Track Kolkata team showcased outstanding professionalism in handling:

Multi-track coordination with smooth transitions among sessions

The success of the event is a testament to the tireless organizers and volunteers who spent hundreds of hours on planning and execution. The SAP Community Network principles of knowledge sharing, collaboration, and support were manifested in every step of the event.

Looking Forward: The Future of SAP Community Events
SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025 has established a new standard for community events in the region. The confluence of leading-edge technical content, industry expert views, hands-on demonstrations, and substantive networking opportunities provided an experience that will leave its mark on all participants.

The event proved that the Kolkata SAP community is not only consuming knowledge from the world but actively taking part in the worldwide SAP universe. The variety of speakers, the technical depth of conversations, and the quality of questions asked by participants reflected the maturity and professionalism of the local SAP community.

Conclusion: A Day That Transformed Perspectives
SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025 was not just a conference - it was a celebration of learning, innovation, and community. Having worked in the SAP ecosystem for a few years now, I departed from the event rejuvenated with the potential that awaits us.

The technical learnings from sessions on AI, cloud transition, and intelligent automation will impact my client work directly. The working relationships forged during the day are already starting to bear collaborative opportunities. Above all, the feeling of community and commonality that pervaded the event was the reminder of why I decided to work in the SAP ecosystem.

To fellow SAP technical consultants who might be thinking of attending future SAP Inside Track events, I do not say enough good things about them. They offer a unique chance to:

Get up to date on the latest SAP technologies and industry trends

Meet peers, experts, and potential collaborators

Give back to the community through knowledge sharing and mentoring

Boost your professional image and career opportunities

Get hands-on experience with innovative solutions and best practices

The success of the SAP community is based on its collaborative nature and shared success. Examples such as SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025 encapsulate these principles to perfection, generating environments where ideas are exchanged freely, bonds are forged, and innovation takes root.

I'm already counting down to SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2026 and the chance to extend this journey of discovery, sharing, and community building. Until that time, I invite all members of the SAP community to remain connected, keep up the learning, and keep adding to that shared knowledge that makes our ecosystem so rich and valuable.

#SAPInsideTrack #SAPCommunity #KolkataSAP #DigitalTransformation #RISEwithSAP #JouleStudio #SAPTechnicalnsultant #AIInBusiness #CloudTransformation

Heartfelt appreciation to the dream team who made every session, every connection, and every moment absolutely count!

@Sayontan_Das @Udity1211 @Diya_Dasupta @Raya_16 @ShreyanSAPO @adrijaMukherjee @SunnyMondal @soumajit_paul @GDas @Pritam_Paulm8  @AmittDubey @Kamallica @Rahul_Agarwal1 @Rajdeep_Dutta43 @Anurag_Dey98 @chandika_sarkar

If you went to SAP Inside Track Kolkata 2025 or any other SAP community event, I'd be happy to know your thoughts and opinions in the comments section below. Let's keep the dialogue going and community spirit burning!

entry.title: SAP CodeJam Roadshow LATAM 2025 - recap
entry.content:
And that's a wrap..... Together with @josh_bentley, @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @SavioMarques, @jessicademarchi and @caiograbalos, we did a few SAP CodeJams in Latin America - four different cities (SÃ£o Paulo ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡·, Lima ðŸ‡µðŸ‡ª, Mexico City ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡½ and Bogota ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡´), various meetups and even joined the SAP Inside Track in SÃ£o Paulo. As part of the roadshow, we run the Getting started with Generative AI Hub on SAP AI Core and ABAP Cloud & ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model CodeJams. It is always great to meet community members where they are and learn about the challenges they face in the different project and how SAP products enable them to tackle these.

 

This is the 2nd roadshow we've done in the region, and what a great experience it was. It was great to meet in person many SAP community members that I've interacted with online in the past. As well as seeing some familiar faces in the locations that we visited in the 1st LATAM roadshow.

SÃ£o Paulo ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡·

@josh_bentley already share a recap of the events in Brazil and the first event in Peru.... so go ahead and check out all the photos he is sharing in the blog post - https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-codejam-discussions/sap-codejam-roadshow-latam-2025-the-first-half-recap-being-present-is-about/td-p/14173987 

Lima ðŸ‡µðŸ‡ª

This is the first time we've done CodeJams in Lima, hosted at the SAP office. It was great to meet the local community and lovely to enjoy some of the local cuisine and coffee :-). Thanks to everyone who joined, even though there was a holiday right in the middle of the week #PeruEsClave.

 

 

 

 

 

Mexico City ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡½

Two amazing events hosted at the IBM offices in Mexico City. I got the opportunity to meet SAP Champions - @Sandra_Solis and @MariettaLopez, whom I've interacted with in the past but never before met in person. Also, Devtoberfest winners - @Sandra_Solis and @eamarce23. Thanks to IBM for hosting, looking forward to more events in Mexico :-). The day after the CodeJams we also had the opportunity to visit the Museo Nacional de Antropologia time and get some time to learn about the different Mexican indigenous cultures.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 

 

 

 

 

Bogota ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡´

Last city part of the 2nd LATAM CodeJam roadshow. The day before the events, there was some time to explore the city a bit and visit the Museo Botero, as well as the Casa de Moneda. The events took place @ the SAP office in Bogota. It was great to catch up with various previous CodeJam attendees, as well as meet some more community members. Special mention to the large crew who joined the CodeJams from Globant (Bogota and Cali).... next time we will organise the event at the Globant office haha

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


 


 

Personally, I always feel energised after connecting with the large Latin American SAP community and I know that it is also a great experience for the other advocates that have joined the roadshows. I'm already looking forward to next year and doing more CodeJams in the region.

entry.title: Give a Kudo, Get a Badge
entry.content:
Last week, we began to assign badges based on the number of kudos a member received. But what about the members who kindly grant kudos? Donâ€™t they deserve some recognition, too?

We think so, and thatâ€™s why, starting tomorrow (Wednesday, September 3), weâ€™re launching our latest progression set â€“ based on kudos given.

As with the other badges that we recently rolled out, this set contains five badges, the first of which has been available since the launch of our current platform last year. The rest are new. You make your way through the set as your activity meets the associated criteria. With these badges, youâ€™ll acquire the second one after giving 30 kudos, the third after 75, the fourth after 200, and the fifth and final after 500.

Thatâ€™s a whole lot of kudos clicked!

Badges will start appearing in peopleâ€™s â€œMy contentâ€ area tomorrow â€“ and weâ€™ll require a few hours to assign them all. Since weâ€™ll once again award them retroactively, you can already anticipate what youâ€™ll attain (if anything) by looking at your accrued activity. How? Hereâ€™s a refresher.

After logging in, select â€œMy contentâ€ from the dropdown in the upper right.

Once youâ€™ve navigated to your â€œMy contentâ€ page, look for the gray box at the top. This area contains several stats, including â€œKudos given.â€ As an example, Iâ€™m once again turning to my anonymous friend (who was the source of my screenshots for previous posts).

With more than 1,700 kudos given, heâ€™ll complete the set during tomorrowâ€™s rollout (having surpassed the threshold for all of the new badgesâ€¦and then some!).

Thatâ€™s some serious gold-medal kudo judo!

Now if you were so inclined, you could go give hundreds of kudos right now (although your finger might get sore from clicking all those thumbs), ensuring that you also complete the set tomorrow. But your kudos carry way more weight when you dole them out deservingly. Why give them away randomly when you can make another memberâ€™s day by delivering a kudo that sincerely indicates that you read and appreciated his or her content?

As someone who writes frequently for SAP Community, I can attest to the warm and fuzzy feeling that comes from a kudo. Clicking that thumb is such a simple act, yet its impact is undeniable for the recipient. It sends the message: â€œI like what you did. Thank you.â€ For that reason, Iâ€™m glad to see that our communityâ€™s cool kudo givers can earn rewards for their generosity.

If you expect to gain one or more â€œkudos givenâ€ badges tomorrow, then let me give you a big thumbs up in advance. Also, as a reminder: If you donâ€™t see your badges by Thursday, September 4, please log out and in again. And if you havenâ€™t racked up the necessary numbers yet for the full set, donâ€™t worry. You can always win the badges later by reading and reacting to contributions throughout the community.  

In conclusion: Keep the thumbing coming for the content that you like, and make sure to check back next week. We plan to unveil more progression badge sets in September, and weâ€™ll announce them weekly right here in Whatâ€™s New. In the meantime, remain an active, positive member, and you may find yourself surprised with even more badges this month.

entry.title: SAP Labs SÃ£o Leopoldo: Desde Paraguay Visitamos las instalaciones de SAP LABS
entry.content:
Nuestra aventura Ã©pica en SAP Labs SÃ£o LeopoldoðŸš€
Spoiler alert: Fue increÃ­ble y queremos contarte todo

ðŸ“…Todo empezÃ³ con un plan (y mucha emociÃ³n)

ImagÃ­nate esto: un email llega a tu bandeja de entrada y Matheus Souza te invita a conocer SAP Labs en Brasil para aprender sobre Inteligencia Artificial. Â¿Tu respuesta? Â¡SÃ, por favor! ðŸ™‹â€â™‚ï¸
AsÃ­ comenzÃ³ nuestra aventura. Meses de planificaciÃ³n, coordinaciÃ³n de agendas, documentos, rutas, hoteles... pero con una sonrisa en la cara porque sabÃ­amos que esto iba a ser Ã‰PICO.

ðŸŽ15 horas de carretera = 15 horas de aventuras

Â¿Conoces esa sensaciÃ³n cuando estÃ¡s tan emocionado por algo que hasta un viaje de 15 horas se siente como una aventura? Pues eso nos pasÃ³.
Desde Ciudad del Este, Paraguay hasta SÃ£o Leopoldo fueron 15 horas en carretera llenas de:

  • Conversaciones sobre IA (obvio)
  • Predicciones sobre lo que Ã­bamos a aprender
  • Chistes internos del equipo
  • Muchas paradas para cafÃ© â˜•

 

Algunos Manejan, otros Duermen!

Parada tÃ©cnica en Porto Alegre: Cultura + DiversiÃ³n

Antes del entrenamiento intensivo, nos dimos una vuelta por Porto Alegre. Â¡QuÃ© ciudad mÃ¡s linda!

Lo mejor de todo: conocer la cultura local, probar comida brasileÃ±a autÃ©ntica, y preparar nuestras mentes para absorber todo el conocimiento que venÃ­a.

Algunos se olvidaron los lentes de Sol ðŸ˜Ž

Paseo Obligatorio en Sao Leopoldo

Hasta participamos de Una maratÃ³n!



Primera vista de SAP Labs: "Â¿Esto es real?"

Llegar a SAP Labs fue como entrar a una pelÃ­cula de ciencia ficciÃ³n. Edificios modernos, tecnologÃ­a por todos lados, y esa sensaciÃ³n de "aquÃ­ es donde nace el futuro". Nos recibieron con la sonrisa mÃ¡s cÃ¡lida del mundo y pensamos: "Esto va a estar buenÃ­simo"

 

Lunes y Martes: Modo aprendizaje ACTIVADO

DÃ­a 1: "Â¡Esto es el futuro!"

Lunes por la maÃ±ana. CafÃ© en mano. EnergÃ­a al 100%. Ready para aprender.

Lo que vimos (y nos volÃ³ la cabeza):

  • IntroduÃ§Ã£o a metodologia AI Journey
  • Business AI SAP 
  • Joule for consultant
  • Joule for developers
  • Hands on: Joule on SAP build code

DÃ­a 2: "Ok, ahora sÃ­ que estamos en otra liga"

Martes. MÃ¡s cafÃ©. MÃ¡s energÃ­a. Listos para el siguiente level.

Round 2 de conocimiento: 

  • Discovery Center
  • SAP Business AI Use cases
  • AI no BTP
  • Hands on: RAG with Hana 

 

Me Toco rendir en el frente! ðŸ˜‚

ðŸŒƒLas noches: Donde nacen las mejores conversaciones

Si pensabas que todo era trabajo, te equivocaste. Las noches en SÃ£o Leopoldo fueron LEGENDARIAS.

El plan: Salir a cenar, conocer la ciudad, probar comida local.

 Conocimiento nivel PRO: Ahora hablamos de IA como expertos (bueno, casi)

 InspiraciÃ³n desbloqueada: Volvimos con mil ideas para implementar en Kuaatec

 Conexiones humanas: Hicimos amigos que estÃ¡n a miles de kilÃ³metros pero se sienten sÃºper cerca

 VisiÃ³n expandida: Entendimos que el futuro no es "algÃºn dÃ­a", es AHORA

 

Â¡Los esperamos en Paraguay!

Crecer junto a las personas es el mayor resultado de todos - y esto lo comprobamos en primera persona.

Brasil nos abriÃ³ sus puertas, nos enseÃ±Ã³, nos inspirÃ³ y nos hizo sentir como en casa. Ahora queremos devolver el favor.

Â¡Equipo SAP, los esperamos en Paraguay! 

Las puertas de Kuaatec siempre estarÃ¡n abiertas para ustedes. Â¡Vengan cuando quieran!

entry.title: ðŸ“¢ SAP Inside Track Pune 2025 â€“ The Community is Back, Stronger than Ever!
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community in PuneðŸ‘‹

We are thrilled to share that SAP Inside Track (SIT) Pune is returning for its second edition on 11th October 2025 at SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune. ðŸš€

After the overwhelming response to the first edition, where we witnessed unmatched energy, knowledge sharing, and community bonding, weâ€™re excited to bring the SAP ecosystem in Pune together once again â€“ this time, with an even bigger focus and a more impactful agenda.

ðŸŒŸWhat is SAP Inside Track?

For those new to it, SAP Inside Track (SIT) is a community-driven event where SAP professionals, experts, and enthusiasts come together to:

  • Share knowledge and insights

  • Learn about the latest innovations in the SAP ecosystem

  • Discuss real-world challenges and solutions

  • Connect and collaborate with like-minded professionals

Itâ€™s an event for the community, by the community, and Pune has already shown how vibrant and powerful this community can be.

 

ðŸ¤–Spotlight Theme for 2025: Business AI in SAP

This year, weâ€™re placing a strong spotlight on Business AI in SAP â€“ exploring how AI is no longer just a buzzword but a powerful enabler across the SAP landscape.

ðŸ”ŽKey Topics You Can Expect:

âœ”ï¸SAP AI Strategy & Roadmap
âœ”ï¸Embedded AI in SAP Solutions
âœ”ï¸Building with SAP AI Agents
âœ”ï¸Business AI Solutions (SAP)
âœ”ï¸SAP Business Data Cloud
âœ”ï¸SAP Business Technology Platform
âœ”ï¸AI Innovations: Partners & Customers

 

ðŸ”‘Why You Should Attend

Attending SIT Pune 2025 means being part of something bigger:
ðŸŽ¤Expert-Led Sessions â€“ Hear directly from thought leaders and SAP experts.
ðŸ¤Networking Opportunities â€“ Build valuable connections with professionals, customers, and partners.
ðŸ’¡Real-World Insights â€“ Learn from success stories, project experiences, and innovation journeys.
ðŸŽ¯Community Spirit â€“ Experience the energy of Puneâ€™s SAP community, where collaboration drives growth.

 

ðŸ“…Event Details

  • Date: 11th October 2025

  • Venue: SAP Labs India, ITPP, Pune

  • Registration: Register here

âš ï¸Please note: Seats are limited â€“ so make sure you secure your spot early.

 

ðŸ™ŒBe Part of the Movement

SAP Inside Track is not just an event â€“ itâ€™s a movement powered by the passion and collaboration of the SAP community.

Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, customer, partner, or simply an SAP enthusiast â€“ this is your chance to:

  • Learn something new

  • Share your own experiences

  • Expand your network

  • And most importantly, celebrate the spirit of community

We canâ€™t wait to welcome you to SIT Pune 2025. Letâ€™s come together for an unforgettable day of Business AI, SAP learning, and community bonding! ðŸš€

See you in Pune! ðŸ’¡

Regards,

SAP Community Pune - Core Team

entry.title: SAP Community Team Spotlight: Josh Bentley - September 2025 Edition
entry.content:
You probably have already seen the past interviews of this series (one / two / three / four / five / six / seven / eight ) which were done by my colleague Marco Santos. Today I am very excited to introduce you to another amazing person behind the SAP Community platform. Here we are with another SAP Community Spotlight, @josh_bentley ! 

 

Fatemeh Zarei (FZ): Hi Josh! Thank you so much for joining us today. To kick things off - would you like to tell us a little bit about your iconic blue beard? How did that all start?

Josh Bentley: So, every superhero has their own origin story - mine's just a little less dramatic. Iâ€™ve been talking about technology for nearly 25 years, and in 2018, I joined the Developer Advocates team after leaving the Cloud Center of Excellence. At a conference - SAP TechEd - the women on our team had all these vibrant hair colors and teased us guys for being boring. I thought, â€œWhy is it only the women showing personality?â€ But I donâ€™t have hair - Iâ€™m bald! So, one of them said, â€œWell, you can dye your beard.â€ I didnâ€™t take it seriously at first, but before SAP TechEd in 2019, I thought, "Why not?" I texted her for tips, used paper towels to mix colors until I got close to SAP blue, and Iâ€™ve kept it ever since. This October marks six years! What keeps me doing it is not just for my ego boost but for the smiles I get from others and the joy they truly show me when they see me.

FZ: Thatâ€™s fantastic! Now, shifting gears a bit - how did you first get involved with the SAP Community?

Josh: That goes back to my pre-sales days, around 2011 or 2012, when we had the â€œBlog It Forwardâ€ campaign that Moshe Naveh started. I was a solution engineer at the time and joined in by answering the campaign questions, then tagging others. That was my first real blog post and entry into the community. I wasnâ€™t one of the founders or key players at the start - it was more of a resource to find answers or share thoughts. But thatâ€™s where it began for me.

FZ: What's your current role on the SAP Community team, and what does a typical day look like?

Josh: These days, I focus on promoting community advocacy. I help highlight whatâ€™s working and where we can improve. My work is all about connecting with people - online and in person - and making sure their voices are heard. Thereâ€™s no â€œtypicalâ€ day, but it involves a mix of content creation, listening to feedback, and strategizing how to make the community better.

FZ: Youâ€™ve done so much! Whatâ€™s one part of the SAP community experience that youâ€™re particularly proud of?

Josh: Itâ€™s hard to pick one, but Iâ€™ll mention three chapters in my SAP life. First, I was part of the team that transitioned SAP from BlackBerry to Apple devices, which was a major enterprise shift. We tackled security, analytics access, BYOD - it was a huge cross-functional effort. Then in pre-sales, I traveled extensively and gave technical demos to some of the biggest companies in the world. I got comfortable and confident in front of customers because I prepared so thoroughly - â€œsharpening the axe,â€ as they say. And in the Developer Advocate role, one big highlight was being trusted to go on stage for SAP TechEd, even during the COVID era when we broadcasted from Frankfurt. Being able to be myself and present on a global stage was unforgettable.

FZ: Amazing. Do you have a favorite or most memorable moment in the community?

Josh: One standout was my first SAP TechEd in Barcelona. Being in a role where I get to visit an amazing city like that is something else, but the real magic was seeing the show floor and the scale of how many SAP mentors and other legacy members made the trip. Some of my first SAP selfies with people I would work with for years were taken at that event.

FZ: How do you stay in tune with the communityâ€™s needs and feedback?

Josh: Three main ways. First, in-person events. Thatâ€™s where people are really open. Online, they might not comment or engage as much, but in person theyâ€™ll say, â€œHey, I saw your video!â€ Second, I post on YouTube and LinkedIn to keep communication flowing. Third, I look at outside platforms like Reddit or Stack Overflow to see what SAP techies are saying in the wild.

FZ: If you could wave a magic wand and change one thing in the community, what would it be?

Josh: Iâ€™d love to see more people offering constructive feedback - with solutions in mind. Not just â€œthis is broken,â€ but â€œhereâ€™s how it could be better.â€ I know we canâ€™t always implement every suggestion - due to technology limitations or staffing - but the community is stronger when members help shape it. The community is bigger than just a website. Itâ€™s every conversation, every event. And we need our members to be co-owners in it.

FZ: And one final question - do you have any advice for those new to SAP or the SAP Community, like me?

Josh: Absolutely. Be your own advocate. No one else is going to push you harder than you will. Learn how your managers listen. In meetings - listen first. Figure out how you can add value. People ask how they can have a role like mine. I say, there are two ways: either start a company and create your own path - or gain experience over time. I didnâ€™t go to school for SAP. I started wiring buildings, setting up IT systems, and just kept learning. Over time, I built a brand and a reputation for being honest, responsive, and knowledgeable. Have a point of view - or put in the work. Thereâ€™s no shortcut. Just engage with kindness and curiosity, and the rest will come.

FZ:  What a wonderful way to wrap things up! Thank you so much, Josh, for joining me today and sharing your SAP journey with us. Itâ€™s been a real pleasure having you here.

Josh: Thanks, Fatemeh. I really enjoyed our conversation.

entry.title: ðŸŒŸ Welcome to the SAP Community Group Nigeria! ðŸŒŸ
entry.content:
Hello SAP Nigeria Enthusiasts! ðŸ‘‹

Weâ€™re super excited to kick off the SAP Community Group in Nigeria, a space created for collaboration, learning, and innovation within our local SAP ecosystem. Whether youâ€™re a seasoned SAP professional, just starting out, or a business leader using SAP solutions to make an impact, this community is for you. Together, weâ€™ll share ideas, learn from each other, and build strong connections that grow the SAP network across Nigeria.

Our vision is to create a vibrant and dynamic community that thrives on collaboration and continuous learning. By sharing your knowledge, engaging in discussions, and supporting one another, we can build a strong SAP ecosystem that not only empowers professionals in Nigeria but also contributes to the global SAP family.

Why join the SAP Community Nigeria Group?
Hereâ€™s what you can look forward to:
ðŸ”¹Local Meetups & Events â€“ From informal gatherings to SAP-focused workshops and knowledge sessions, weâ€™ll create opportunities to connect in person.
ðŸ”¹Knowledge Sharing â€“ Publish blogs, ask questions, and share insights on SAP solutions and innovations. Your contributions form the backbone of this community.
ðŸ”¹Networking & Growth â€“ Build relationships with SAP experts, professionals, and enthusiasts across Nigeria and beyond.
ðŸ”¹Celebrate Success Stories â€“ Share how SAP is driving transformation in your career, business, or industryâ€”we want to spotlight local heroes.
How you can get involved

ðŸ‘‰ Join the Group  
ðŸ‘‰Post your Introduction  (tell us about your SAP journey, location, and interests)

ðŸ‘‰Stay tuned for events and discussions that bring learning and collaboration to life
Letâ€™s Build the Future â€“ Together
This community will only be as strong as the people in it. By sharing your knowledge, engaging in discussions, and supporting others, youâ€™ll help us build a vibrant SAP ecosystem in Nigeria.

ðŸš€Together, letâ€™s make the SAP Community Nigeria a hub of innovation, collaboration, and growth!

About the Initiator 

Charles Nwankwo is an SAP PP/QM Consultant with over six years of professional experience. His career has spanned multiple industries, including manufacturing, consumer goods, beverages, pharmaceuticals, and chemicals. He has contributed to several end-to-end SAP projects, ranging from Greenfield and Brownfield S/4HANA implementations to public cloud deployments. Beyond technical expertise, these experiences have deepened his understanding of the challenges and opportunities that organizations face during SAP transformation.

Driven by a passion for collaboration, he established this community to create a platform where SAP professionals in Nigeria can connect, exchange insights, and collectively drive innovation.

@lauraschmitz #SAP#SAPCommunityNigeria

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE
entry.content:
Hello All,

In this Blog I would like to share some knowledge on how to Create a basic CAPM application using Sap Business Application Studio and we are going to use the SAP S/4 Hana system to connect and fetch the data.

Lets Divide this Blog into three sections:

1. Prerequisites

2.  Connecting with S/4 HANA Data Base.

3.CRUD Operations

In this Blog lets see what are all the subscriptions and settings to be done to start our application.

Let.. Set.. Go!!

NOTE: May Be This Blog Seems To Be Lengthy, Still Give It A Try U Will Surely Love IT ðŸ˜€

 

 

 

Step1: Lets Subscribe to SAP HANA CLOUD:

Open your SAP BTP trial account and navigate to Service Market Place. Search for S/4 Hana Cloud

 

After Selecting HANA Cloud, you will get the screen like below and Please click on Create.  

 

 

 

Click on Tools and then Create.

 

Once you click on View Subscription , here it shows as below image

 

Note: Remember after subscribing any service you should add security because every service will have its own Role Collections.

Now lets navigate to Users and Click on Default Identity Provider.

 

 

Click on Assign Role Collections, there you can find roles related to Hana cloud( You will find all the roles for the services that are subscribed).

 

 

Select them and click and assign.

 

You can find them under your role collections. Now you have your HANA DB. Lets open it.

 

Step2: Open SAP HANA Cloud and Lets Create Instance.

 

Click on Create Instance and then select HANA Cloud DB.

 

 

 

Here its asking us from which environment our service is going to run, So we need to sign in to Cloud Foundry with your Default Identity Provider Credentials( your email id).Then it returns you this Message.

 

 

 

 

 

Select your space which is default given as dev ( I renamed its as Dev). Instance name can be anything of your choice.

 

 

Enter any password of your choice.

Now leave the next step as it is with storage of 16gb and next please select allow all IP addresses so that it will not block any.

 

 

Click on the three dots over there and there you will find an option to Start. In 10 to 15min your instance would be running.

 

 

Step 3: Setup Work Zone(Fiori Launch Pad):

Search in Market Place > Work Zone

 

Click Create 

 

Please select the Plan as Subscriptions > standard. 

 

Our Subscription would be in progress.

 

 

Note: If this error exists, please subscribe to your Cloud Identity Services.

If you get this, please add trust configuration. So follow the steps below

Initially follow the same process of Subscribing Cloud Identity Provider User Role Collections

Fix: Configure OIDC Trust in SAP BTP

  1. Log in to SAP BTP Cockpit
    Go to your subaccount where you want to subscribe to the application.
  2. Go to Security â†’ Trust Configuration
    This is where you manage identity provider (IdP) trust settings.
  3. Add SAP Cloud Identity Services as an OIDC IdP
    • Click Establish Trust.
    • Choose SAP Cloud Identity Services.
    • Select OpenID Connect (not SAML).
    • Enter the required details (Issuer URL, Client ID, etc.) â€” if you have Identity Authentication service (IAS) set up, you can copy these from there.
  4. Set as Default for Business Users

                  ï‚· Make sure the new OIDC IdP is assigned to business users in your subaccount.

  1. Save & Retry Subscription
    Go back to the subscription page and try again.

Assign the Role collections to users what are all available. Check them all and Click on Assign.

Step 4: CREATE A HANA DB INSTANCE:

Navigate to Service Market Place > Select HANA DB > Create > Under Plan select the Instance.

 

Step 5: Subscribe to Business Application Studio.

Note: By default SAP Business Application Studio would be subscribed. If not subscribe it by yourself.

 

Are you all done!! Lets get into next Episode soon...

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

Hope itâ€™s helpful ðŸ˜‰

 

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.

entry.title: SAP Community Hobbies Series: Mind Your Step (Walking and Hiking)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm Moshe Naveh from the SAP Community team. Today, I'm excited to kick off a new SAP Community virtual journey: a blogging series focused on the passions and hobbies of our community members. In this series, community members will share about themselves, their hobbies, how they got started, how they incorporate them into their routine, and how you can learn them as well. This series will be enriched with fun stories, inspiring anecdotes, images, videos, and more. Each community member will tag another member to join the series via their mutual interest. For now we've lined up community members with the following hobbies: painting, Mindfulness, Yoga, skydiving, running, and more! 

I want to start the series by sharing a hobby that has been my passion for a long time: long walks and hiking. It all started when I did my first step, around the age of eighteen monthsðŸ˜‰. However, when I was a teenager I started taking long walks. I used to love to walk on the beach just before the sun switched turns with the moon. There was a sculpture of a bird that always inspired and reminded me that I'm free to go wherever I want. 

The title of this blog post, "Mind Your Step," reflects my state of mind when I walk. I try to be mindful of every step I make. Each step not only brings you closer to the finish line but also can take you deeper into your own thoughts and relaxation. 

Now, I would like to share with you some pictures from my most significant hikes and walks that really are a part of who I'm today:

Bolivian Jungle

Around 2004, I went on a long hike in the jungles of Bolivia (a couple of hours drive from La Paz). It was an amazing experience where I met new people and formed meaningful connections. For a couple of days we walked through jungles, slept in remote areas, and relied on each other's trust to navigate the unknown. 

Isla Grande, Brazil

Another memorable hike from around 2004 was my visit to Isla Grande which is an island not far away from Rio De Janeiro. After settling down in the camping ground, I met two cool people which later became my friends. Shortly afterwards we decided to do a hike of 40 km to cross the island from bottom to top. I was the man of the day as I saved everyone by bringing "just in case" food in my bag. My friends thought we would find food in the middle of the jungle:). They returned a favor by searching for me when I got lost in the jungle (they found meðŸ˜‰). We finished our hike when we reached the tip of the island. The traditional dish of rice and beans was so tasty. For sure it was refreshing after eating Tuna, cookies and Goose liver Pate for five days.  The timing of arrival to the finish line was perfect as we got there just in time for the weekly ferry to the main village.

Luxembourg's Little Switzerland

Three years ago, I did the longest walk I've ever done in one day (30 Km). It was in the magnificent area of Luxembourg called "Little Switzerland." The trail resembled Switzerland's mountains and had stunning views. The focus wasn't just the amazing nature and yummy blackberries but also my state of mind during the hike. It was with certainty one of my most special days in my entire life:

That's how I look when I finish a 30 KM hike 

And it was such an amazing view:

I'm standing on a bridge over a swamp

 

and here are the tasty blackberries:

 

25 km walk

During my recent holiday, I decided to dedicate one day for a long walk. I walked on the beach or not far away from it for 7-8 hours. I tried to walk always in the shade of buildings as it was very hot. I constantly bought food, snacks, and drinks (which seems to be my favorite part of the walkðŸ˜‰). 

This is how I looked after finishing the journey:

Moshe standing next to a tree after finishing 25 KM by foot

 

Running!

Recently, I started practicing for a race so I started running. Although I was already in shape from walking 15â€“20 km daily, running gave me a whole new feeling of energy:

After my first 12 KM run!

  and I really enjoy stopping in my favorite street and eating all sorts of fruits that are available for everyone:

Grapes

Recently I started to be interested in races. Here's a picture from a race that was raising funds for children with cancer:                                                                   

Moshe in a running race

Subscribe to this post as I'll add in the comments pictures from the upcoming race, after I complete it:).

Why did I start walking and running?

I really enjoy walking as it calms me down, excite me and keeps me in shape. It's a kind of meditation for me. Running is also very relaxing but at a different pace than walking. I hope I'll keep doing both for a long time, while doing it right to maintain a healthy body. Also starting a day with a morning run keeps you energized at least until lunch:).

Passing the baton:

Now, I'd like to hand it over to Achim ( @act45 ). Achim has been a community member for many years and I'm sure many of you know him. I was fortunate to meet Achim in person in SAP TechEd. Achim will share his amazing experiences and journey around being a yoga teacher and a Mindfulness enthusiastic. As I practice Mindfulness during my runs and walks, I think it's a great continuation for our blogging series.

Do you do long walks or hike? Share the pictures and stories behind them in the comments section. Feel free to share other hobbies you have! 

If you're interested in joining the series, please reach out to me via community@sap.com.

Let's get this journey going! I hope you all enjoy the great posts coming-up!

entry.title: SAPfluencer Award 2025 Exciting News !!
entry.content:
As an SAP Data & AI/ML Developer, mentor, and someone passionate about visibility in the SAP community, Iâ€™m thrilled to be part of the jury for the SAPfluencer Award 2025. This award celebrates people who make a real impact in the SAP ecosystem with their ideas, passion, and dedication.
